title: How many Israelites left Egypt as the Bible said? - Quora

response.answer_text: 600k men (rounded down) of men between the ages of 20 to 60 (service age).So we calculate 2M, rounded up, including Levites, women, children and elderly men (over 60).Also another 2.4 million ‘Erev Rav’ left Mizrayim about that time, some staying with us.reference the appendix in The Recent Complex Creation.The Exodus was before the end of the 6th dynasty, about 108 years PRIOR to the Hyksos occupation.reference ‘Torah Discovery Chronology’ volume III of the YeC Moshe Emes series for Torah and science alignment.

It is possible that the Exodus story was based on a small band of slaves who escaped and travelled north to join up with their compatriots already living in Judah. However, the strong consensus of historians` is that no Israelites left Egypt just as the Bible said. Biblical scholars now consider the biblical Exodus story to be a national foundation myth.
